file_content.text: I am here as requested. Which one of you is the Veil?
I am the Veil.
No, I am the Veil.
No, it is me. I am the Veil.
Actually, none of us are the Veil.
Because all of us are the Veil.
I have a notorious reputation, especially when people steal from me.
You shouldn't be.
Aggghhh!
Still, we are all very glad to make your acquaintance, cult master.
It's a pleasure to make yours. I understand you have the CN-12?
And you.
You want the CN-12.
Ah, you speak of the CN-12.
Everyone wants the CN-12.
But few are willing to pay the price.
What will it take to convince you to give me the CN-12?
You have something I need.
Your cult.
The streets of Nar Shaddaa only have room for one true voice.
The denizens of Nar Shaddaa do not want to enrich your silly puppet, Paladius.
Give us control of your cult, and we will give you the CN-12.
I'll assume you're not dumb enough to demand such steep payment without justification.
Let's hear your offer.
So what is it? What are you offering?
You seem to have made a mistake. I am not Lord Paladius. I am not a fool.
Do you think I'm stupid?
You seem to have made a mistake. I am not a naive thug like Destris or Rylee.
Do you think I'm stupid?
That is why we wanted to deal with you.
I could just kill you one at a time until one of you agrees to give me the CN-12.
You really want to die.
Hear us out.
The fool that runs your cult serves only himself.
The lowlifes that run your cult are brutal enough, but they lack vision.
Why settle for a cult, when you can have an empire?
Our resources extend beyond the CN-12. Armies need weapons, ships need engines.
What does your cult provide you now? Donations? Artifacts?
We offer that and more. Our reach extends across the galaxy.
Simply send the signal from one of these devices, and our servants will come to your aid anywhere in the galaxy. Not just on Nar Shaddaa.
You will give me the CN-12, and you will serve me.
[Force Persuade] CN-12. Now.
We will give you the CN-12.
We will serve you.
Please, let us join your cult.
I wish I had thought of it myself.
Excellent suggestion.
Of course.
Thank you, my lord.
I don't let people join for free.
I require a donation.
Of course, my lord.
Take the CN-12, and as a sign of our loyalty, take this for your ship. The rarest tech we possess, after the CN-12.
It's a deal. You may take control of the cult, and I will take the CN-12.
Agreed.
Thank you, but I still have the problem of which one of you to kill first.
I'd rather kill you.
You wouldn't want to try that.
This room is rigged with a bomb tied to our biometric signatures.
If we die, so do you.
One. [Kill him.]
Ugh.
You killed him!
Don't be foolish. This will get you nowhere.
You speak bravely, but your partner seems worried. Perhaps I should kill him next.
Your friend isn't so sure.
I didn't come here to shed blood, but you pushed me to the edge.
What about this? [Shock him.]
Aggghhh!
Give me the CN-12.
Two. [Kill him.]
Ugh.
If you kill me, you die. Do you--do you really want to risk that?
You don't really want to die like this, do you?
Three. [Kill him.]
I don't have to kill you to get what I want.
I guess not. [Shock him.]
Aggghhh!
Hasn't it occurred to you that I have servants in your organization who have dismantled the bombs?
There's nothing you can do.
If I can't kill you, then I will shock you one by one until one of you relents. Starting with you.
Enough. [Shock him.]
Aggghhh!
Aggghhh!
Aggghhh!
No! Wait! Don't do this. You can have the CN-12.
What are you doing?
Coward!
Maybe I am. But I told you it was a bad idea to challenge a Sith. I'm cutting my losses while I still have a hide.
Here, take the CN-12, just leave us alone, okay?
I will leave you alive, but I don't trust your friends.
They die. [Kill One and Two.]
Damn you, Sith.
I will leave you alive, but I don't trust your friend.
You may live. [Kill Two.]
Ugh.
Your fate was sealed when you decided to challenge a Sith Lord.
No. [Kill them.]
Here. Take the CN-12. Just leave me alone, please?
Thank you for finally seeing sense.
Certainly.
Let this be a warning.
You are very merciful, my lord. Thank you.
You never should've challenged me.
No. [Kill him.]
No, please.
Then let's hope that you keep your promises with respect to my cult.
Fine, the cult is yours.
You have made a wise choice, my lord.
Here is the CN-12. We assure you, you will not regret this.
